alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Cherry; Custer; Logan; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 29 at 9:37PM CDT until May 29 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Southwestern Brown County in north central Nebraska... Northern Logan County in west central Nebraska... Northwestern Custer County in central Nebraska... Western Blaine County in north central Nebraska... Thomas County in north central Nebraska... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 937 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Brownlee to 7 miles west of Purdum to 11 miles north of Stapleton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Thedford, Dunning, Halsey, Purdum, Brownlee, Elsmere, Wood Lake, Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River, Moon Lake, Hawley Flats, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Long Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Linscott, Shanklin Bluff, Brown Lake, Koshopah, Natwick and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 219 and 222. Highway 2 between mile markers 204 and 252. Highway 83 between mile markers 115 and 181. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and north central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and north central Nebraska.
